Class LlamaFunctionGenerator

java.lang.Object
strategies.llama.LlamaFunctionGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
FunctionGenerationStrategy
public class LlamaFunctionGenerator extends Object implements FunctionGenerationStrategy
The LlamaFunctionGenerator class is responsible for generating functions using the Llama API. It implements the FunctionGenerationStrategy interface and provides a method for generating function outputs based on a textual description.

Example usage: 

 
 ConfigLoader config = ConfigLoader.getInstance();
 LlamaFunctionGenerator llama = LlamaFunctionGenerator.builder()
         .withApiKey("your-api-key-here")
         .withModel("llama3.1-70b")
         .withTemperature(0.7)
         .withMaxTokens(150)
         .build();

 // Build the bookRequestToSQLFunction using the LlamaFunctionGenerator
 Function<String, String> bookRequestToSQLFunction = FunctionGenerator<String, String>.builder()
         .withDescription(
                 "Converts user input into SQL queries for the books table. For text queries, do not be case sensitive.")
         .withInputType(String.class)
         .withOutputType(String.class)
         .withStrategy(llama)
         .build();

      public String generateFunctionOutput(String description)
      Generates a function based on the provided description by calling the Llama API.
      Specified by:
      generateFunctionOutput in interface FunctionGenerationStrategy
      Parameters:
      description - the textual description of what the function should do
      Returns:
      a JSON-formatted string representing the generated function output
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the function generation process fails
